com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter

Class ServiceRequest<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter.Request<T>
      • com.lukeleber.scandroid.interpreter.ServiceRequest<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data that represents the configuration option

    public class ServiceRequest<T>
extends Request<T>

    A type of Request that is used to request a piece of information from a remote system. ServiceRequests consist of a PID and a Service on which the PID should be requested under. This is typically represented textually as "$XX$YY" where "XX" is the service (from 00 to FF) and "YY" is the PID (from 00 to FF). For example, $01$04 translates to "Get me the calculated engine load from the live datastream".

    Not all vehicles support all services and not all services support all PIDs. However this problem can be lessened through the use of a Profile that automatically detects the constructs that a vehicle supports.

        public ServiceRequest(Service service,

      • ServiceRequest

        public ServiceRequest(Service service,
              PID<T> pid,
              Handler<T> handler)
        Constructs a ServiceRequest with the provided Service, PID, Handler, and Unit. This constructor is equivalent to ServiceRequest(service, pid, handler, pid.getDefaultUnit());
        Parameters:
        service - the Service that this request is to be sent for
        pid - the PID that is being requested
        handler - the Handler that is invoked when a response to this request is received from the remote hardware

      • ServiceRequest

        public ServiceRequest(Service service,
              PID<T> pid,
              Handler<T> handler,
              Unit preferredUnit)
        Constructs a ServiceRequest with the provided Service, PID, Handler, and Unit.
        Parameters:
        service - the Service that this request is to be sent for
        pid - the PID that is being requested
        handler - the Handler that is invoked when a response to this request is received from the remote hardware
        preferredUnit - the Unit whose unmarshaller should be called
